jrobots.simulation.simulationObjects.droppables

Class Droppable

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrobots.simulation.simulationObjects.droppables.Droppable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mine, TankTrap

    public abstract class Droppable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Mines suit the cowards. They serve you pursuers.
    But those who drive in circles, beware! They serve you, too.

    Droppables don't move, so there are no motion targets for them. They may collide with panzers.

    Relevant aspects:

    • Droppables' deployment:
      • individual graphics (colored like parent dropper)
      • individual reload time
      • arming delay after deployment
        (time driven / distance driven / initial displacement)
    • Detonation:
      • trigger (individual distance driven)
      • (individual trigger delay, if any)
      • individual explosion generation
    • Explosion:
      • explosion animation (being gaudy) (individual?)
      • individual explosion radius (area effect)
      • damage dispersion
        (in relation to distance / trigger focused)
      • force dispersion (in relation to distance)
    • Alteration
      • individual decomposition after certain time (with animation)
        There is a life time guarantee of at least 20% of the mean decay time.
    Since:
    2009
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • calculateMotion

        public final void calculateMotion(SimulationState state,
                                  double elapsedTime)
        Actually, Droppables procure no movement. With this routine a mine is able to alter over time:
        • Perform blinking and other graphic features
        • Manage an internal age
          (note: the mine may only deleted from outside this routine)

        SOMETIME: remove final flag if needed. If done, always make super call first.

        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - since last call [s]

      • checkTrigger

        public abstract void checkTrigger(SimulationState state,
                                  MotionTargetPanzer panzerTgt)
        is called to detect collisions.

        May be overridden to implement individual behavior.

        Parameters:
        state -
        panzerTgt -

      • DROPPER_REFRACTORY_PERIOD

        public abstract double DROPPER_REFRACTORY_PERIOD()
        Time until dropper gear can be reactivated after drop. It is class specific.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • LAUNCHABLE_TRIGGER_RADIUS

        public abstract double LAUNCHABLE_TRIGGER_RADIUS()
        trigger radius [m] for Launchables to set up the Droppable's effect (explosions etc.). It is class specific.

        Note that this value only applies to approaching Launchables.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • LIFE_TIME_AVG

        public abstract double LIFE_TIME_AVG()
        Average life time [s] of this Droppable. It is class specific.

        The actual life time will be subject of normal distribution.

        Every descendant may have its own value.

      • TRIGGER_RADIUS

        public abstract double TRIGGER_RADIUS()
        trigger radius [m] for Panzers to set up Droppable's effect (explosions etc.). It is class specific.

        Also determines the activation distance.
        (see Droppable#calculateMotion)

        Every descendant may have its own value.
